wines.description: A classic expression of Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc from a family domaine managed since 2005 by Thibault Bizet and his mother Maryline. Crafted from vines averaging 25 years old across 7.25 hectares of diverse Sancerre terroirs, this wine embodies the mineral-driven, crystalline purity that defines the region's finest whites.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with vibrant aromas of grapefruit and gunflint, accompanied by enticing notes of tropical fruits, candied apricot, and ripe melon. Fresh wild herbs mingle with delicate floral nuances and soft minerality, while a distinctive crushed gravel character adds complexity. Subtle hints of coriander, sage, and palo santo bring an herbaceous dimension to this expressive bouquet.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, this medium-bodied wine displays a supple attack with notable body and structure. Waves of citrus, particularly lemon and lime, blend seamlessly with white-fleshed fruits including ripe yellow apple, pear, and melon rind. The wine's high acidity provides a tart, crisp backbone, while crushed gravel and clean salinity emerge mid-palate, reinforcing the terroir's mineral signature. The generous mouthfeel balances freshness with concentration.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is lively and intense, characterized by excellent minerality and good persistence. Aromatic notes resurface with a touch of spice, while the clean salinity and bright acidity leave the palate refreshed and invigorated. The balanced conclusion showcases both elegance and depth.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2027. This wine is best enjoyed within 2-4 years of vintage to capture its vibrant fruit and crystalline minerality, though quality examples can develop additional complexity with careful cellaring.

wines.description: A playful sparkling rosé from Spain created by renowned winemaker Chris Ringland, who personally selects unoaked Chardonnay and Grenache from high-altitude, cool-climate vineyard sites. Grown on alluvial red-brown loams and white limestone mixed with rocky slate, this fun, party-ready bubbly delivers sweet fruit character and lively effervescence in a convenient mini-bottle format.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents an inviting bouquet of sweet red berries and strawberry mousse, accented by vibrant strawberry and citrus notes. Dark cherry and raspberry aromas add depth and complexity, while small, persistent bubbles release waves of fresh fruit character. The overall aromatic profile is bright, fruity, and immediately appealing.
tastingNotes.palate: Sweet and exuberantly fruity on the palate, this sparkling rosé bursts with flavors of raspberries, sweet strawberries, and strawberry jam. Citrus notes of lemon and tart apple provide refreshing counterpoints to the red fruit core, while undertones of dark cherries and currants add dimension. A juicy yet balanced core reveals subtle spicy pepper and anise nuances that elevate the wine beyond simple sweetness.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is light, delicate, and medium in length, with persistent sweet raspberry flavors. Tart raspberry and black cherry notes transition to a unique grapefruit-with-sugar character that balances the wine's inherent sweetness with refreshing acidity. The conclusion is playful and satisfying.

wines.description: A robust Malbec showcasing the variety's characteristic dark fruit intensity and structured tannins. While Sky Devil Wines is primarily known for their California Bordeaux varietals from Knights Valley, Sonoma, and Napa Valley, this expression demonstrates the winery's ability to craft compelling wines with depth and character from Malbec grapes.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose reveals concentrated aromas of ripe blackberry, dark plum, and black cherry, complemented by notes of blueberry compote. Subtle hints of violet and lavender add floral elegance, while undertones of cocoa, espresso, and sweet baking spices—vanilla, cinnamon, and clove—emerge from oak influence. A whisper of leather and tobacco leaf adds complexity.
tastingNotes.palate: Rich and full-bodied on the palate, this Malbec delivers bold flavors of blackberry jam, dark plum, and cassis. The wine's velvety texture is supported by ripe, well-integrated tannins that provide structure without harshness. Mid-palate notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and toasted oak blend seamlessly with the fruit core. A touch of black pepper and dried herbs adds savory complexity, while the wine's generous alcohol provides warmth and weight.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and subtle smoke. Firm but polished tannins lend grip and structure, suggesting excellent aging potential. The conclusion is both powerful and refined.

wines.description: A bold, full-bodied Cabernet Franc from the oldest vines at Zephaniah Farm Vineyard, a third-generation working farm in Loudoun County, Virginia. This wine represents the estate's commitment to crafting wines with skill and passion, earning recognition including silver medals at the 2014 and 2015 Governor's Cup competitions.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose is both powerful and elegant, opening with aromas of ripe blackberry and dark cherry, accented by notes of cassis and black plum. Layers of dried herbs—thyme, oregano, and bay leaf—mingle with subtle hints of green bell pepper, a hallmark of the variety. Undertones of cedar, tobacco leaf, and graphite add complexity, while a delicate floral note of violet provides lift.
tastingNotes.palate: Medium to full-bodied with a supple texture, the palate showcases vibrant flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and soft red fruit. The wine's structure is defined by fine-grained tannins that provide grip without astringency. Mid-palate notes of dried herbs and just a dusting of spice—black pepper and clove—add savory complexity. A refreshing edge of crisp acidity balances the ripe fruit, while subtle oak influence contributes nuances of vanilla and toasted wood.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to earthy notes of graphite, dried herbs, and subtle leather. The wine's balanced structure and lively acidity ensure a clean, refreshing conclusion that invites the next sip.

wines.description: A rich and enveloping Primitivo from Salento, Puglia, crafted by Tenuta Giustini as a homage to the Papadopoli family's Greek roots. Their ancestors settled in the heart of Salento to devote themselves to peasant life and viticulture. This wine offers exceptional value and has increased in popularity, delivering the warmth and generosity characteristic of Southern Italian reds.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose is immediately expressive, revealing ripe fruit aromas of dark cherry, blackberry jam, and plum, complemented by notes of dried fig and raisin. A distinctive fine note of milk chocolate adds richness and depth, while subtle hints of sweet spice—cinnamon and vanilla—emerge from the wine's oak influence. Undertones of dried Mediterranean herbs and a whisper of black pepper add complexity to this generous bouquet.
tastingNotes.palate: Round, well-balanced, and harmonious on the palate, this Primitivo delivers concentrated flavors of ripe dark fruit—blackberry, black cherry, and plum—alongside notes of dark chocolate and espresso. The wine's medium to full body is supported by soft, velvety tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Mid-palate notes of caramel, vanilla, and toasted oak blend seamlessly with the fruit core, while a touch of dried herbs and balsamic adds savory depth. The wine's natural warmth and generous alcohol lend a comforting, enveloping character.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is medium to long, with persistent dark fruit and chocolate flavors gradually transitioning to notes of espresso, dried fig, and sweet spice. The wine's harmonious balance ensures a satisfying conclusion that is both rich and refined.

wines.productName: Scarpetta Pinot Grigio DOC Friuli (NOVA only) 2023
wines.description: A distinctive Pinot Grigio from Friuli-Venezia Giulia that transcends the variety's reputation for simplicity. Sourced from two distinct terroirs—the Grave and Colli Orientali zones—this wine showcases Pinot Grigio's ability to deliver both elegance and complexity. The combination of soil types yields a wine with body, bright acidity, and exceptional minerality.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with enticing aromas of ripe white peach, lychee, and ripe melon, complemented by notes of crisp apple and ripe pear. Citrus accents of lemon and lime zest add brightness, while delicate floral notes—white flowers and acacia—provide lift. A distinctive mineral character of wet stones and crushed gravel emerges, along with subtle hints of guava, coriander, sage, and palo santo that add herbal complexity. A faint salmon-pink hue in the glass hints at the wine's textural depth.
tastingNotes.palate: Light on its feet yet surprisingly complex, the palate reveals flavors of stone fruits—white peach and apricot—and melon, balanced by crisp apple and citrus notes. The wine's medium body is supported by bright, refreshing acidity that provides structure and vibrancy. Mid-palate minerality—crushed gravel and saline notes—adds textural interest and reinforces the wine's terroir-driven character. The overall impression is one of elegance and precision, with each element in perfect harmony.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering flavors of citrus, stone fruit, and minerals. The wine's bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated and ready for the next bite or sip.

wines.description: An expressive Sauvignon Gris from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, crafted from 100% estate-grown grapes. This pink-skinned varietal creates a voluptuous, single-varietal wine with powerful floral aromatics and excellent structure. Recent vintages have earned critical acclaim, including 91 points from James Suckling and a silver medal at the 2022 Best of Loudoun wine competition.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose is aromatic and distinctive, revealing a characteristic slate or 'wet rock' minerality that defines this wine. Vibrant citrus notes of fresh orange and lemon zest mingle with delicate spring-time flowers and white blossoms. Layers of ripe pear, almond, and a touch of honey add richness, while the wine's powerful floral character—hallmark of the pink-skinned Sauvignon Gris varietal—provides elegance and lift.
tastingNotes.palate: The palate exhibits good weight and a voluptuous texture, supported by crisp-apple acidity that provides structure and balance. Flavors of ripe pear, citrus, and almond dominate, while the wine's mineral core—wet stones and crushed gravel—adds textural interest and reinforces the terroir's influence. The balanced structure ensures that richness and freshness coexist in perfect harmony, creating a wine that is both generous and refined.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering flavors of citrus zest, pear, and wet stone minerality. The wine's crisp acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated.

wines.description: A fresh, vibrant expression of Trebbiano d'Abruzzo from a young, family-run winery in the mountainous Tavo Valley. Owners Antonella di Tonno and Rodrigo Redmont tend 30 hectares of vineyards with a strong commitment to sustainability, crafting high-quality, affordable wines that showcase the region's unique terroir. This 2024 vintage delivers exceptional value at an approachable price point.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose is bright and inviting, revealing intense aromas of ripe apples and peaches, complemented by notes of tangerine and citrus flowers. Delicate floral nuances add elegance, while subtle hints of white pepper and Mediterranean herbs provide complexity. The overall aromatic profile is fresh, racy, and immediately appealing.
tastingNotes.palate: Light to medium-bodied with a lovely pithy texture of mineral and delicate extract, the palate showcases refreshing flavors of ripe apple and peach, balanced by tangy citrus notes of tangerine and lemon zest. The wine's bright acidity provides structure and vibrancy, while a gentle, tangy tastiness persists through the mid-palate. Subtle mineral notes—wet stones and saline—add textural interest and reinforce the wine's terroir-driven character.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and persistent, bolstered by good weight and tangy tastiness that lingers pleasantly. The wine's bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated and ready for the next sip.

wines.description: An elegant, complex Cabernet Sauvignon from one of Stellenbosch's leading producers. This wine showcases Thelema Mountain Vineyards' commitment to crafting world-class wines with meticulous attention to detail. The 2015 vintage earned a critics' score average of 91/100, with professional reviewers praising its balance of power and refinement.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose is complex and inviting, revealing aromas of crème de cassis, dark blackcurrant, and ripe black plum, complemented by notes of red currant and dark cherry. Distinctive green leaf and bell pepper aromas add classic Cabernet character, while subtle hints of cigar wrapper spice, cedar, and tobacco leaf emerge. Undertones of graphite, dark chocolate, and espresso reflect the wine's 18 months in barrel, 45% of which was new French oak.
tastingNotes.palate: Plush yet wonderfully elegant on the palate, this wine delivers concentrated flavors of cassis, blackcurrant, and dark plum, balanced by vibrant red currant and cherry notes. The wine's full body is supported by fine, silky tannins that provide structure without harshness, creating a very fresh and elegant style of Cabernet. Mid-palate notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and subtle oak spice add depth, while a touch of green bell pepper and dried herbs adds savory complexity. The wine's excellent balance ensures that power and finesse coexist harmoniously.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and cedar. Fine tannins lend grip and structure, suggesting excellent aging potential. The conclusion is both powerful and refined, leaving a lasting impression.

wines.description: A svelte and contemplative Chenin Blanc from old bush vines rooted in decomposed granitic soils of the Bottelary Hills, Stellenbosch. The dry land vines, planted in the early 1980s with epic vistas of Table Mountain, weathered the tempestuous 2016 vintage to produce small clusters of intensely concentrated fruit. Barrel fermented and matured in old French oak, this wine is intentionally Loire-like in style and benefits greatly from bottle maturation.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose is delicate and nuanced, opening with a combination of citrus blossom and yellow fruits—golden apple and ripe pear. Green apple and red pear notes add freshness, while subtle hints of toasted almond and gentle ginger provide complexity. Distinctive aromas of honey, rooibos tea, and a tell-tale chalky minerality emerge, adding layers of interest to this contemplative, shy expression of Chenin Blanc.
tastingNotes.palate: Svelte and medium-bodied with a lovely pithy texture, the palate reveals flavors of green apple, golden apple, and yellow fruits, balanced by bright acidity. Subtle notes of toasted almond, honey, and rooibos tea add richness without heaviness, while a distinctive chalky, mineral texture reinforces the wine's terroir-driven character. The wine's old-vine concentration and barrel fermentation contribute to its complex, layered profile, while restraint and elegance define the overall impression.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and mineral-driven, characterized by a tell-tale chalky texture and bright acidity. Lingering flavors of citrus blossom, yellow fruits, and toasted almond persist, while the wine's Loire-like structure ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion.
